categories.name: Mixed/Random
categories.description: A mix of questions from all categories

questions.question: What was the first full-length animated Disney feature film?
options: Snow White and the Seven Dwarfs
questions.explanation: Snow White released in 1937 was Disney's first animated feature.

questions.question: What year did Beauty and the Beast release?
questions.explanation: Beauty and the Beast released in 1991 and was the first animated film nominated for Best Picture.

questions.question: What type of fish is Nemo?
questions.explanation: Nemo is a clownfish which live among sea anemones.

questions.question: What is the name of the kingdom in Tangled?
questions.explanation: Corona is where Rapunzel was born as a princess.

questions.question: In Frozen what is Kristoff's reindeer's name?
questions.explanation: Sven is Kristoff's loyal reindeer companion.

questions.question: What is the restaurant name in Ratatouille?
questions.explanation: Gusteau's is where Remy helps Linguini cook.

questions.question: In Moana who is the demigod that helps her?
questions.explanation: Maui is the shapeshifting demigod voiced by Dwayne Johnson.

questions.question: In Zootopia what is the sloth's name at the DMV?
questions.explanation: Flash is the hilariously slow sloth at the DMV.

questions.question: What is the name of Woody's horse in Toy Story?
questions.explanation: Bullseye is Woody's loyal horse who appears in Toy Story 2.

questions.question: Which film features the song Circle of Life?
questions.explanation: Circle of Life opens The Lion King as Simba is presented.

questions.question: What was the first Pixar feature film?
questions.explanation: Toy Story released in 1995 was the first fully computer-animated feature film.

questions.question: What is the name of the emotion characters' headquarters in Inside Out?
questions.explanation: Headquarters is where Joy, Sadness, and other emotions work.

questions.question: In Up how many balloons lift Carl's house?
questions.explanation: Pixar calculated it would take about 20,622 balloons.

questions.question: What is the name of the robot in WALL-E that he falls in love with?
questions.explanation: EVE is the sleek probe robot WALL-E falls in love with.

questions.question: In Coco what is the name of the Land of the Dead holiday?
questions.explanation: Dia de los Muertos is the Mexican holiday celebrated in Coco.

questions.question: What company does Mr. Incredible work for as a claims adjuster?
questions.explanation: Insuricare is where Bob Parr works his boring desk job.

questions.question: In Monsters Inc what powers the city?
questions.explanation: Monstropolis is powered by children's screams until they discover laughs work better.

questions.question: What is the Pizza Planet truck?
options: A recurring Easter egg in Pixar films
questions.explanation: The Pizza Planet truck appears in nearly every Pixar film as an Easter egg.

questions.question: What is Baby Yoda's real name?
questions.explanation: Grogu is the real name of the Child revealed in The Mandalorian.

questions.question: What planet is Luke Skywalker from?
questions.explanation: Luke grew up on the desert planet Tatooine with his uncle and aunt.

questions.question: What color is Mace Windu's lightsaber?
questions.explanation: Mace Windu has a unique purple lightsaber requested by Samuel L. Jackson.

questions.question: Who is Kylo Ren's mother?
questions.explanation: Kylo Ren is Ben Solo, son of Leia Organa and Han Solo.

questions.question: What is the name of Han Solo's ship?
questions.explanation: The Millennium Falcon is Han's famous light freighter.

questions.question: Which planet is destroyed by the Death Star in A New Hope?
questions.explanation: Alderaan, Princess Leia's home planet, is destroyed by the Death Star.

questions.question: What is the name of Thor's hammer?
questions.explanation: Mjolnir is Thor's enchanted hammer that only the worthy can lift.

questions.question: What is Tony Stark's superhero name?
questions.explanation: Tony Stark is Iron Man - genius, billionaire, playboy, philanthropist.

questions.question: What planet is Gamora from?
questions.explanation: Gamora is from Zen-Whoberi before Thanos adopted her.

questions.question: What is the name of the fictional metal in Black Panther?
questions.explanation: Vibranium is found in Wakanda and makes up Captain America's shield.

questions.question: Who is the villain in the first Avengers movie?
questions.explanation: Loki leads the Chitauri invasion of New York in The Avengers.

questions.question: What stone is in Vision's forehead?
questions.explanation: The Mind Stone powers Vision and was originally in Loki's scepter.

questions.question: Who is the villain in The Little Mermaid?
questions.explanation: Ursula is the sea witch who tricks Ariel into trading her voice.

questions.question: What is the name of the villain in 101 Dalmatians?
questions.explanation: Cruella de Vil wants to make a fur coat from dalmatian puppies.

questions.question: Who is Simba's evil uncle in The Lion King?
questions.explanation: Scar kills Mufasa and takes over Pride Rock.

questions.question: What villain says 'Off with their heads'?
questions.explanation: The Queen of Hearts from Alice in Wonderland loves ordering beheadings.

questions.question: Who cursed Aurora in Sleeping Beauty?
questions.explanation: Maleficent cursed Aurora to prick her finger on a spindle.

questions.question: What is Jafar's position in Agrabah?
questions.explanation: Jafar is the Royal Vizier who wants to take over Agrabah.

questions.question: Who is the villain in Tangled?
questions.explanation: Mother Gothel kidnapped Rapunzel to use her magical hair.

questions.question: What does Hades rule in Hercules?
questions.explanation: Hades is god of the Underworld and wants to overthrow Zeus.

questions.question: How many official Disney Princesses are there?
questions.explanation: There are 12 official Disney Princesses in the lineup.

questions.question: Who is the first Disney Princess?
questions.explanation: Snow White from 1937 is the first Disney Princess.

questions.question: Which princess has the power to heal with her hair?
questions.explanation: Rapunzel's magical hair can heal injuries and reverse aging.

questions.question: Which princess is not royalty by birth or marriage?
questions.explanation: Mulan is a warrior, not a princess, but is honorary.

questions.question: What is Ariel's father's name?
questions.explanation: King Triton is Ariel's father and ruler of Atlantica.

questions.question: Which princess talks to animals and has forest friends?
questions.explanation: Snow White, Aurora, and Cinderella all communicate with animals.

questions.question: Who is the youngest Disney Princess?
questions.explanation: Snow White is canonically 14 years old, the youngest princess.

questions.question: Which princess cuts her hair in her movie?
questions.explanation: Both Mulan and Rapunzel cut their hair in their films.

questions.question: Who composed the music for The Lion King?
questions.explanation: Hans Zimmer composed the score with songs by Elton John and Tim Rice.

questions.question: Which movie features the song 'A Whole New World'?
questions.explanation: 'A Whole New World' is from Aladdin, sung on the magic carpet ride.

questions.question: Who wrote the songs for Frozen?
questions.explanation: The Lopez duo wrote 'Let It Go' and all Frozen songs.

questions.question: What Disney movie features the song 'Under the Sea'?
questions.explanation: 'Under the Sea' is Sebastian's song in The Little Mermaid.

questions.question: Who composed most Disney Renaissance films like Little Mermaid and Beauty and the Beast?
questions.explanation: Alan Menken composed 8 Disney films including the Renaissance era.

questions.question: Which movie features the song 'How Far I'll Go'?
questions.explanation: 'How Far I'll Go' is Moana's signature song written by Lin-Manuel Miranda.

questions.question: What song does Elsa sing when building her ice palace?
options: Do You Want to Build a Snowman
For the First Time in Forever
questions.explanation: 'Let It Go' plays as Elsa builds her ice palace and embraces her powers.

questions.question: Who wrote the songs for Encanto?
questions.explanation: Lin-Manuel Miranda wrote all songs including 'We Don't Talk About Bruno'.

questions.question: What year did Disneyland open?
questions.explanation: Disneyland opened July 17, 1955 in Anaheim, California.

questions.question: What is the name of the castle at Magic Kingdom?
questions.explanation: Cinderella Castle is the 189-foot icon of Magic Kingdom.

questions.question: What is the Star Wars land called?
questions.explanation: Star Wars: Galaxy's Edge is set on the planet Batuu.

questions.question: How many Disney theme park resorts exist worldwide?
questions.explanation: There are 6 Disney resorts in California, Florida, Tokyo, Paris, Hong Kong, and Shanghai.

questions.question: What is a Hidden Mickey?
options: Mickey shaped design hidden in parks
questions.explanation: Hidden Mickeys are subtle Mickey shapes hidden throughout Disney parks.

questions.question: What is the spherical structure at EPCOT called?
questions.explanation: Spaceship Earth is the iconic geodesic sphere at EPCOT's entrance.

questions.question: Which Disney park is the largest by acreage?
questions.explanation: Animal Kingdom is about 580 acres, the largest Disney park.

questions.question: What is the mine train coaster at Magic Kingdom?
questions.explanation: Big Thunder Mountain Railroad is the 'wildest ride in the wilderness'.

questions.question: What famous phrase is at Disneyland entrance?
questions.explanation: 'The Happiest Place on Earth' is Disneyland's famous tagline.

questions.question: What year did Walt Disney World open?
questions.explanation: Magic Kingdom opened October 1, 1971.

questions.question: What was the first Disney cruise ship?
questions.explanation: Disney Magic launched in 1998 as the first Disney cruise ship.

questions.question: What is Disney's private island called?
questions.explanation: Castaway Cay is Disney's private Bahamas island.

questions.question: How many ships are in the Disney Cruise fleet as of 2024?
questions.explanation: Disney has 5 ships: Magic, Wonder, Dream, Fantasy, and Wish.

questions.question: What is the adults only area on Disney ships called?
questions.explanation: Quiet Cove has the adults-only pool and relaxation areas.

questions.question: What unique dining concept does Disney Cruise use?
questions.explanation: Rotational dining means you visit different restaurants but keep your servers.

questions.question: What is the kids club on Disney cruise ships?
questions.explanation: Oceaneer Club is for kids ages 3-12.

questions.question: What is Disney's newest ship as of 2022?
questions.explanation: Disney Wish debuted July 2022.

questions.question: What is the adult beach on Castaway Cay?
questions.explanation: Serenity Bay is the adults-only beach.

questions.question: What does the ship horn play when departing?
options: When You Wish Upon a Star
questions.explanation: Disney ships play 'When You Wish Upon a Star' on departure.

questions.question: What is Pirate Night on Disney Cruise?
questions.explanation: Pirate Night includes dinner, deck party, costumes, and fireworks.

questions.question: What year was Walt Disney born?
questions.explanation: Walt Disney was born December 5, 1901 in Chicago.

questions.question: What was Walt Disney's brother's name?
questions.explanation: Roy O. Disney cofounded Disney with Walt in 1923.

questions.question: What was Mickey Mouse's original name?
questions.explanation: Walt wanted Mortimer, but wife Lillian suggested Mickey.

questions.question: What year did Mickey Mouse debut?
questions.explanation: Mickey debuted in Steamboat Willie on November 18, 1928.

questions.question: Where is Walt Disney buried?
questions.explanation: Walt Disney was cremated and his ashes are at Forest Lawn in Glendale.

questions.question: What was the name of Walt's first successful cartoon character?
questions.explanation: Oswald was created before Mickey, but Walt lost the rights.

questions.question: What was the first Disney Broadway musical?
questions.explanation: Beauty and the Beast opened on Broadway in 1994.

questions.question: What is the longest running Disney Broadway show?
questions.explanation: The Lion King has run since 1997 and is 3rd longest running Broadway show ever.

questions.question: Which Disney Broadway show features puppetry by Julie Taymor?
questions.explanation: Julie Taymor's puppetry and masks are iconic in The Lion King.

questions.question: What Disney movie became a Broadway show in 2014?
questions.explanation: Aladdin opened on Broadway in March 2014.

questions.question: Which show features the song 'Seize the Day'?
questions.explanation: 'Seize the Day' is the Act 1 finale of Newsies.

questions.question: What flavor is the famous Dole Whip?
questions.explanation: Pineapple Dole Whip is the iconic Disney parks frozen treat.

questions.question: What is the bestselling food item at Disney parks?
questions.explanation: Churros are the top seller with millions sold annually.

questions.question: What is the name of the restaurant inside Pirates of the Caribbean at Disneyland?
questions.explanation: Blue Bayou is the atmospheric restaurant inside the ride.

questions.question: What shape are the famous Disney ice cream bars?
questions.explanation: Mickey Premium Ice Cream Bars are shaped like Mickey's head.

questions.question: What is the signature drink at Oga's Cantina in Galaxy's Edge?
questions.explanation: Oga's Cantina has many signature drinks including Blue Milk.

questions.question: What restaurant has the 50s TV dinner theme at Hollywood Studios?
questions.explanation: 50's Prime Time Cafe servers act as family members from the 50s.

questions.question: What does 'Ohana' mean in Lilo and Stitch?
questions.explanation: Ohana means family, and family means nobody gets left behind.

questions.question: Which Disney Princess is based on a real person?
questions.explanation: Pocahontas is based on a real Native American woman from the 1600s.

questions.question: What is Buzz Lightyear's famous catchphrase?
options: You've got a friend in me
questions.explanation: 'To infinity and beyond' is Buzz's iconic catchphrase.

questions.question: Which Disney animated film has both parents alive throughout?
questions.explanation: In Mulan, both parents are present and alive the whole film.

questions.question: What 'A113' refers to in Pixar films?
questions.explanation: A113 is the CalArts classroom where many Pixar animators studied.

questions.question: Who voiced both Darth Vader and Mufasa?
questions.explanation: James Earl Jones' iconic voice brought both characters to life.
